meanings.definition: To break up or demolish with a jackhammer.
meanings.sent1: The construction worker jackhammered the concrete to make way for a new building.
meanings.sent2: The road crew jackhammered the old pavement to lay down fresh asphalt.
meanings.sent3: The noisy jackhammered startled the birds nearby, causing them to fly away.
meanings.sent4: Her words jackhammered through his heart, shattering his defenses.
meanings.sent5: The rhythmic sound of the jackhammered echoed through the construction site.

meanings.sent1: He jackhammered all day to break through the tough rock.
meanings.sent2: The construction team jackhammered tirelessly to finish the project on time.
meanings.sent3: The determined worker jackhammered with precision, earning the admiration of his colleagues.
meanings.sent4: The rhythmic pounding of the jackhammered filled the air with energy and determination.
meanings.sent5: She felt the vibrations of the jackhammered in her hands as she operated the powerful tool.

meanings.definition: Having been subjected to the action of a jackhammer.
meanings.sent1: The jackhammered pavement showed signs of wear and tear.
meanings.sent2: The jackhammered wall displayed cracks from the intense vibrations.
meanings.sent3: The jackhammered surface felt rough underfoot, evidence of its recent treatment.
meanings.sent4: The jackhammered area looked uneven compared to the untouched sections.
meanings.sent5: The jackhammered ground bore the marks of its forceful encounter with the tool.
